text:
He stopped, breathless. 

“Why did I go to her?” 

He shook his head. 

“I had no business there.” 

He remembered her tears, her fear. 

“I wanted her heartache. 

I’m a contemptible wretch.” 

He walked along the canal bank. 

At the bridge, he paused. 

“Soon, I’ll be in a prison van.” 

He looked at the sign. 

“What will I feel then?” 

He chuckled, a bitter laugh. 

“How trivial all this is.” 

He turned away, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist reflects on his emotional turmoil and the desperation for connection amidst his impending fate.
